column4: so last night I used "shutdown -h 1:00" and went to bed. it seemed to shutdown fine. but when I turned the computer back on gnome-panel is completely borked
that command isn't correlated, as in its a very common command, but rebooting could have caused some other problem
is there anything I could do to diagnose what's wrong with gnome-panel?
what is up with gnome-panel?
the first time I logged in it was unresponsive, then i ctrl-alt-bksp logged out and back in again, and it disappeared
ps -A | grep gnome-panel shows it is running, though
but alt-f1 and alt-f2 do not work
goodmami is it repeatable after another reboot?
what happens when you sudo killall gnome-panel
it should auto restart
i only did "kill -9 (id of gnome-panel)" but that didn't do anything special... lemme try your suggestion
after 15 seconds no restart
its not showing in ps?
hmm, log out and back in now
ok... brb..
that seemed to do it! I wish I knew what was actually going on, but re-logging in after killing the panel seemed to work
thanks for the help (and Flannel for pitching in, too)
try sudo shutdown -h now and then reboot
if you want to test the problem
ok, will do... brb
if it happens again, there could be a bug
didn't die this time.
ok, wierd
yeah... well i'm running hardy, so if it's a bug hopefully it didn't make it into intrepid... i'll keep an eye out for it though
